forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog and a slight chance of showers and thunderstorms after 4am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 61. South wind 3 to 7 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog and a slight chance of showers and thunderstorms. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 76. South wind 3 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As twilight descends upon Boston this evening, a gentle haze envelops the skyline, hinting at the patchy fog mentioned in the forecast. The atmosphere feels thick with the promise of subtle moisture, a precursor to the showers and perhaps an occasional rumble of thunder that may arrive later in the night. With the temperature settling around a comfortable 61 degrees, the night air carries a humid warmth, ideal for leisurely strolls along the waterfront or an evening spent on a cozy porch, wrapped in a light shawl.

Tomorrow's forecast carries a similar thread, with the prospect of more fog and a slight chance for isolated thunderstorms weaving through the fabric of a mostly cloudy day. Highs will push towards 76, creating an inviting backdrop for quiet pursuits. One might choose to visit a local café for a few hours, savoring a book or engaging in light conversation over steaming cups of coffee as the clouds keep the sun playfully at bay. For those drawn outdoors, breathable clothing paired with a light jacket would be appropriate, allowing for comfort against the shifting weather. As night gives way to day, the world outside may feel a little more serene, perfect for engaging with the subtleties of life in this vibrant city.
